# Arpeggio: Dominant 7#5 in C (Shape: C)

## Brief Presentation
The Dominant 7#5 arpeggio in the key of C features the notes C (root), E, G#, and B. This arpeggio has a distinct sound due to the augmented 5th interval, giving it a sharp, bright quality. It is commonly used in jazz, fusion, and other genres where musicians want to add tension and color to their playing.

## Notes and Intervals
- Root: C
- Major 3rd: E
- Augmented 5th: G#
- Minor 7th: B

## Genre and Musical Flavor
The Dominant 7#5 arpeggio is typically found in jazz music, particularly in dominant and altered dominant chords. In jazz improvisation, this arpeggio can be used to add tension and dissonance, creating a sense of movement and unpredictability in solos. Its sharp and exotic sound adds a unique flavor to compositions and improvisations, often enhancing the overall harmonic richness of the music.
